means: 勇敢地面对( affront的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He pretended to be affronted, but inwardly he was pleased.
sentence.Network_cn: 他假装受到了冒犯，但其实内心很高兴。

sentence.Network_en: Reggie reacted with the same affronted horror Midge had felt.
sentence.Network_cn: 雷吉的反应是又羞愤又害怕，和米奇的感觉一样。

sentence.Network_en: He hoped they would not feel affronted if they were not invited .
sentence.Network_cn: 他希望如果他们没有获得邀请也不要感到受辱。

PerfectNetExp.abs: affront 公开侮辱affronted 被侮辱的affrontedly 被侮辱地
职称英语专业考试相关词汇_百度文库 ... Sage 贤人，圣人 60． Affronted 被冒犯的 61． Indolent 懒惰的，不痛的 62．.
affront 公开欺侮affronted 被欺侮的affrontedly 被欺侮地
He felt affronted at being refused admission to the conference ., 被拒入会场 , 他觉得受到侮辱.

list.abs: his speech was an affront to all members of the community ., 他的话对社区所有成员是故意的侮辱.
and " an affront others or fabricating facts to slander others , " and other circumstances ., 及 " 公然侮辱他人或者捏造事实诽谤他人 " 等情形.
how to affront risk of chinese abroad project enterprise in the financial crisis ., 金融危机中我国境外工程企业如何面对风险.
It ' s a personal affront to me and every member of our congress ., 这对我和对我们会议的全体人员都是一种人身侮辱.

entry.def: If something affronts you, you feel insulted and hurt because of it.

example.tran: 让卡斯帕罗夫感到特别受辱的一件事

entry.def: If something is an affront to you, it is an obvious insult to you.

example.ex: It's an affront to human dignity to keep someone alive like this...
example.tran: 如此维持一个人的生命是对人类尊严的冒犯。

example.ex: She has taken my enquiry as a personal affront.
example.tran: 她将我的询问当成了人身侮辱。

means.word_mean: 1. treated with insolent and rude language especially openly and intentionally

auth_sentence.content: Two birds affronted with a human head Between their beaks.

auth_sentence.content: Sihanouk was deeply affronted by the coup.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sihanouk was deeply affronted by the coup.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sihanouk was deeply affronted by the coup.

auth_sentence.content: It affronted his can-do business sense and his idea of self-reliance.
auth_sentence.res_content: It affronted his can-do business sense and his idea of self-reliance.
